practice.enterEquation.problem.oldText: <par>Consider the equation <block-math/> Make some small modification to it, so that it's different yet still mathematically equivalent.</par><input-space><par><equation-input><label>Enter the equation here</label></equation-input></par></input-space>
practice.enterEquation.problem.latestText: <par>Consider the equation <block-math/> Make some basic modification to it, so that it's different yet still mathematically equivalent.</par><input-space><par><equation-input><label>Enter the equation here</label></equation-input></par></input-space>

practice.enterEquation.solution.oldText: <par>There are many ways in which the equation <inline-math/> can be adjusted. For instance, we can switch the left and the right side, resulting in <block-math/> Of course there are infinitely many other valid solutions too.</par>
practice.enterEquation.solution.latestText: <par>There are many ways in which the equation <inline-math/> can be adjusted. For instance, we can switch the left and the right side, resulting in <block-math/> Of course there are infinitely many other valid solutions too.</par>

practice.enterEquation.feedback.exactlyE.latestText: You have entered the equation without making any modifications. You must rewrite the equation to something different.

practice.enterEquation.feedback.notEquiv.oldText: This is not equivalent to the original equation. You have done something to it that's mathematically not allowed.
practice.enterEquation.feedback.notEquiv.latestText: This is not equivalent to the original equation. You have done something to it that's mathematically not allowed, or that's too different for us to detect.
